x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Local councils and public health organizations often rely on manual reporting systems (emails, spreadsheets, phone calls) to collect and track community health issues such as food contamination, water pollution, or pest outbreaks. This process is slow, inconsistent, and error-prone, leading to delays in identifying trends or responding to potential health risks. Without automation, early warning signs are missed, and preventable health incidents spread before action can be taken.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

HealthWatch would be an AI enabled workflow automation platform that centralizes all public health reports from citizens, health workers, and local authorities.

How It Works:

  1. Residents or health officers submit issues via web or mobile forms.

  2. Predictive Intelligence automatically categorizes and prioritizes reports (e.g., “urgent food poisoning,” “moderate pest control”).

  3. Flow Designer triggers workflows to assign cases to the right department (e.g., sanitation, environmental health, or inspection).

  4. Dashboards display live data for trend tracking and outbreak mapping.

  5. Virtual Agent can handle basic public health inquiries 24/7.

ServiceNow Products / Capabilities to Use:

  • App Engine (custom app for case submission and tracking)
  • Predictive Intelligence (auto categorization and prioritization)
  • Flow Designer (workflow automation and routing)
  • Performance Analytics (dashboards and insights)
  • Virtual Agent (citizen facing chatbot)

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration with public health APIs or council databases (for report validation).
  • Mobile form or chatbot interface for easy citizen reporting.
  • Optional GIS integration for location-based tracking and mapping.
  • Secure cloud infrastructure for data storage and privacy compliance (e.g., UK GDPR).

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Data privacy and protection for sensitive citizen health data.
  • Integration difficulties with legacy government systems.
  • User adoption barriers among non digital communities.
  • Need for accurate AI training data to classify reports correctly.
  • Coordination among multiple agencies using different workflows.
